data.title: Japanese star Angela Aki to teach English on TV
data.meta_description: The soon to be mother will start her new TV program one month before her pregnancy is due.
data.text:
30 Sep â€“ Singer-songwriter Angela Aki will be teaching English for NHK E-tele's new program, "Angela Aki's SONG BOOK in English", starting January of next year, according to a report on Tokyo Hive's website.

On 15 September, which was also her 34th birthday, Angela announced that she was 5 months pregnant with her first child. The show is scheduled to start one month before her pregnancy is due.

"Angela Aki's SONG BOOK in English" is a new English educational program that incorporates language and entertainment for learning. It will feature a translation workshop of Western hit songs, and will also give viewers the chance to enjoy music.

Angela Aki is Italian-American-Japanese singer who started out her career in the United States before moving back to Japan, making history as the first artist to ever perform in the famous Nippon Budukon Hall, solo (with just her piano, sans backup singers, band or opening act.)
